item.title: Double Pointers
item.description: #dsa 3 types Double Pointers(Fast, Slow) Double Pointers (Left, Right) Double Pointers (Sliding Window) Mainly used to solve Array, String & Linked List related problems Reduce time complexity by one dimension, O(n^2) to O(n) for example Example Use Cases .

item.title: 2's Complement (è¡¥ç )
item.description: Abstract Â§ We are adding extra 1 to the 1â€™s Complement (åç ) This makes sure that there is only one 0 by adding 1 to after converting from Sign-and-Magnitude (åŸç ) to 1â€™s Complement (åç ) This is the form that computers use to store integers Conversion Â§ From 2â€™s Complement back to Dec Â§ Taken the value Sign Bit (negative if it is 1) and perform addition with value of whole Magnitude (all are positive) References Â§ 2â€™s Complement Addition and Subtraction .

item.title: Sign-and-Magnitude (åŸç )
item.description: Abstract Â§ Represent positive and negative decimal integers in binary Divide the number of bits into 2 parts, one part for negative number, another part for positive number Cons Â§ Require extra Logic Gates Â§ The Adder logic cant be used for subtraction This can be avoided using 1â€™s Complement (åç ) or 2â€™s Complement (è¡¥ç ) Terminologies Â§ Sign Bit Â§ The first bit from left 0 denotes positive 1 denotes negative Magnitude Â§ All the bits in the encoding except Sign Bit Reference Â§ Sign-and-Magnitude Addition and Subtraction Hello-Algo .

item.title: 1's Complement (åç )
item.description: Abstract Â§ For negative number, all bits are inverted except the Sign Bit which is 1 when we need to perform the computation For positive number, all bits remind the same Benefits Â§ Reuse Logic Gates Â§ We re-can use Adder logic gates, without building extra logic circuit like a subtraction logic gates Cons Â§ Mathematically wrong definition of 0 Â§ We have +0 (when all bits are 0) & -0(when all bits are 1) under this encoding, this can be solved by 2â€™s Complement (è¡¥ç ) .

item.title: ECS Exec
item.description: Abstract Â§ Obtain a shell into ECS from a local machine Enable ECS Exec for ECS Â§ Existing ECS Â§ Only new Task under the Service will have the ECS Exec enabled aws ecs update-service \ --cluster <CLUSTER_NAME> \ --service <SERVICE_NAME> \ --enable-execute-command New ECS Â§ Based on what I know, there isn't a way to enable ECS EXEC from the GUI console Option 1.
